storyTitle: As Manager, I want to receive alerts for attendance anomalies to achieve proactive workforce management

testCases.title: Validate alert configuration and saving
preconditions: Manager is logged into the system with valid credentials
Manager has appropriate role-based permissions to access alert settings
Dashboard is accessible and functioning properly
At least one notification channel (email/SMS/in-app) is available for configuration

steps.action: Navigate to the dashboard and locate the alert settings menu option
steps.expectedResult: Alert settings menu option is visible and clickable

steps.action: Click on the alert settings menu to access the alert configuration page
steps.expectedResult: Alert configuration UI loads successfully with all configuration options displayed including threshold settings and notification channel selections

steps.action: Set late arrival threshold to 15 minutes in the threshold configuration field
steps.expectedResult: Threshold value is accepted and displayed correctly in the input field

steps.action: Set absence alert threshold to trigger immediately upon absence detection
steps.expectedResult: Absence threshold setting is configured and displayed correctly

steps.action: Select email notification channel by checking the email checkbox
steps.expectedResult: Email checkbox is checked and email notification is enabled

steps.action: Select SMS notification channel by checking the SMS checkbox
steps.expectedResult: SMS checkbox is checked and SMS notification is enabled

steps.action: Select in-app notification channel by checking the in-app checkbox
steps.expectedResult: In-app checkbox is checked and in-app notification is enabled

steps.action: Click the Save button to save the alert configuration settings
steps.expectedResult: Settings are saved successfully and a confirmation message is displayed indicating successful save operation

steps.action: Navigate away from the alert settings page to another section of the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Navigation is successful and user is on a different page

steps.action: Return to the alert settings page by clicking on alert settings menu again
steps.expectedResult: Alert settings page reloads successfully

steps.action: Verify that the late arrival threshold displays 15 minutes
steps.expectedResult: Late arrival threshold shows the previously saved value of 15 minutes

steps.action: Verify that the absence threshold displays immediate trigger setting
steps.expectedResult: Absence threshold shows the previously saved immediate trigger configuration

steps.action: Verify that email, SMS, and in-app notification channels are all checked
steps.expectedResult: All three notification channels (email, SMS, in-app) are displayed as selected with checkboxes checked

postconditions: Alert configuration settings are persisted in the database
Manager remains logged into the system
Alert settings page displays the saved configuration
System is ready to monitor attendance data based on configured thresholds

testCases.title: Verify alert delivery for late arrival
preconditions: Manager has configured alert settings with late arrival threshold set to 15 minutes
Email, SMS, and in-app notification channels are enabled in alert settings
Manager's email address and phone number are registered in the system
Real-time attendance monitoring system is active and functioning
Test employee exists in the system with scheduled shift start time
Current time is within business hours for testing

steps.action: Note the current system time and the scheduled shift start time for the test employee
steps.expectedResult: Shift start time is clearly identified and documented

steps.action: Simulate an employee late arrival event by marking the employee as arrived 20 minutes after their scheduled shift start time
steps.expectedResult: Late arrival event is recorded in the attendance system with timestamp showing 20 minutes late

steps.action: Wait for the system to process the attendance data and detect the anomaly
steps.expectedResult: System detects the late arrival anomaly as it exceeds the 15-minute threshold and generates an alert

steps.action: Check the manager's email inbox within 5 minutes of the late arrival event
steps.expectedResult: Alert email is received containing employee name, late arrival time, scheduled time, and delay duration

steps.action: Check the manager's mobile phone for SMS notification within 5 minutes of the late arrival event
steps.expectedResult: Alert SMS is received containing key information about the late arrival including employee name and delay

steps.action: Log into the dashboard and check the in-app notifications section
steps.expectedResult: In-app notification is displayed showing the late arrival alert with complete details

steps.action: Verify that all three notifications were received within 5 minutes of the simulated late arrival event
steps.expectedResult: Timestamps on email, SMS, and in-app notifications confirm delivery within the 5-minute SLA

steps.action: Click on the late arrival alert in the dashboard notifications panel
steps.expectedResult: Alert details expand showing full information including employee details, scheduled time, actual arrival time, and delay duration

steps.action: Click the Acknowledge button on the alert
steps.expectedResult: Acknowledge action is processed successfully

steps.action: Verify the alert status has changed to acknowledged
steps.expectedResult: Alert status is updated to 'Acknowledged' with timestamp and manager name displayed

steps.action: Refresh the dashboard page
steps.expectedResult: Alert continues to show acknowledged status after page refresh, confirming status persistence

postconditions: Late arrival alert is logged in the system with acknowledged status
Alert history contains the complete record of the alert and acknowledgment
Email, SMS, and in-app notifications have been successfully delivered
Manager can view the acknowledged alert in alert history
System continues to monitor for new attendance anomalies

testCases.title: Test alert acknowledgment and dismissal
preconditions: Manager is logged into the dashboard with appropriate permissions
Multiple active alerts exist in the system (at least 3 alerts for comprehensive testing)
Alerts include various types such as late arrivals and absences
Alert history logging functionality is enabled
Manager has not previously acknowledged or dismissed the test alerts

steps.action: Navigate to the alerts section of the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Alerts page loads successfully displaying the alerts interface

steps.action: Locate and click on the active alerts tab or section
steps.expectedResult: Active alerts section is displayed showing all unacknowledged and undismissed alerts

steps.action: Count and verify the number of active alerts displayed
steps.expectedResult: All active alerts are listed with complete information including employee name, alert type, timestamp, and severity

steps.action: Review the details of the first alert including alert type, employee information, and timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Alert details are clearly displayed and readable with all relevant information present

steps.action: Click on the Dismiss button for the first alert in the active alerts list
steps.expectedResult: Dismiss confirmation dialog appears asking for confirmation of the dismissal action

steps.action: Confirm the dismissal action by clicking Yes or Confirm in the dialog
steps.expectedResult: Alert is dismissed successfully and a confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Verify that the dismissed alert is removed from the active alerts list
steps.expectedResult: The dismissed alert no longer appears in the active alerts section and the alert count is reduced by one

steps.action: Note the exact timestamp when the alert was dismissed
steps.expectedResult: Current system timestamp is recorded for verification purposes

steps.action: Navigate to the alert history section from the alerts menu
steps.expectedResult: Alert history page loads successfully displaying historical alert records

steps.action: Search for the recently dismissed alert in the alert history using employee name or alert ID
steps.expectedResult: Dismissed alert is found in the alert history records

steps.action: Click on the dismissed alert entry in the history to view full details
steps.expectedResult: Alert details expand showing complete information including original alert data

steps.action: Verify the alert status field shows 'Dismissed' in the alert history record
steps.expectedResult: Alert status is clearly marked as 'Dismissed' in the status field

steps.action: Verify the dismissal timestamp matches the time when the alert was dismissed
steps.expectedResult: Dismissal timestamp in the history record matches the noted dismissal time with accuracy within seconds

steps.action: Verify the manager's name or ID is logged as the person who dismissed the alert
steps.expectedResult: Manager's identification information is correctly recorded in the dismissal record for audit purposes

steps.action: Return to the active alerts section
steps.expectedResult: Active alerts page is displayed again

steps.action: Select a different alert and click the Acknowledge button instead of Dismiss
steps.expectedResult: Alert is acknowledged and status changes to 'Acknowledged' while remaining visible in the alerts list

steps.action: Verify the acknowledged alert shows updated status but remains in the alerts view
steps.expectedResult: Alert displays 'Acknowledged' status with timestamp and manager information, distinguishing it from active unacknowledged alerts

postconditions: Dismissed alert is removed from active alerts list
Dismissed alert is logged in alert history with correct status and timestamp
Acknowledged alert remains visible with updated status
Alert history contains complete audit trail of all actions
Manager remains logged into the system
All alert actions are properly recorded for compliance and audit purposes
